example.text: The recent allegations of the [[user]]’s mishandling of sexual misconduct is alarming. It’s good to see steps being taken in the right direction, but the Intel Committee will continue to investigate the CIA & I hope the agency is willing to work with us toward accountability on this. [[url]]

Paid leave is something I'm passionate about & this week I had conversations that'll help us get closer to making it a reality for all workers. We held the 4th meeting of our bipartisan paid leave working group — focused on small businesses & how they play a role in this effort. [[url]]

I met with the American Society of Civil Engineers to update them on implementation of these two bills. Here at home, that means more money for our local airports and highways, plus maintenance for the Schuykill River.

Mr. Chair, I rise in opposition to this amendment. Instead of debating the very many pressing national security issues that our country faces, my Republican colleagues are, unfortunately, using this amendment and many others to continue their needless crusade against the LGBTQ+ community.

Paid leave is something I'm passionate about & this week I had conversations that'll help us get closer to making it a reality for all workers. We held the 4th meeting of our bipartisan paid leave working group — focused on small businesses & how they play a role in this effort. [[url]]

Today [[user]] left for Japan to attend the G7 summit in Hiroshima. As world leaders meet in this historic city, I'm urging them to work together to promote global peace and security. Read more of my thoughts in my [[user]] op-ed below. [[url]]

Yesterday, after much consideration, I voted against HR 2. I'm glad Republicans are taking this issue seriously, but I don't believe it will appropriately address the pressing issues at our southern border. Read my full statement on the bill here: [[url]] [[url]]
